subject: Law
title: The Thirteenth Amendment: Abolishing Slavery
description: A quick win: understand The Thirteenth Amendment: Abolishing Slavery.

hook.text: The Constitution originally protected slavery. It took a civil war and 600,000 deaths to change that.

buildup.text: The Thirteenth Amendment (1865) abolished slavery and involuntary servitude throughout the United States.

discovery.text: It was the first amendment to directly limit private conductâ€”not just government action.

twist.text: An exception remained: involuntary servitude 'as punishment for crime.' Prison labor persists under this clause.

climax.text: Congress gained power to enforce the amendment through legislation, enabling future civil rights laws.

punchline.text: Freedom was written into law. Its full promise is still unfinished.

quiz.question: What exception does the Thirteenth Amendment include?
